intro: Hosackia helleri, commonly known as Heller's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor conditions. Hosackia helleri plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
